meanings.definition: The position or office of a treasurer.
meanings.sent1: She was proud to be appointed to the treasurerships at the school.
meanings.sent2: The treasurerships required careful management of the organization's finances.
meanings.sent3: The treasurerships at the club were so sought after, they had to hold a lottery to choose the new treasurer.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, treasurerships are like the captains of the ship, steering the financial course.
meanings.sent5: The treasurerships were like the guardians of the organization's money, ensuring it was safe and well-spent.

meanings.definition: The responsibilities or duties of a treasurer.
meanings.sent1: Managing the treasurerships involved overseeing the budget and financial transactions.
meanings.sent2: The treasurer took on the treasurerships with dedication and attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The treasurerships included counting every penny twice, just to be sure.
meanings.sent4: The treasurerships were like a puzzle to solve, ensuring all the pieces fit perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The treasurerships were the backbone of the organization, keeping the financial aspect running smoothly.
